flawed_nl_solution:
She needs 60 inches of rope because 10 x 6 equals <<10*6=60>>60
The six-foot length of rope is 72 inches long because 6 x 12 = <<6*12=72>>72
The six-foot length of rope would give her 12 pieces because 72 / 6 = <<72/6=12>>12
She would need 5 of the 1-foot ropes because 60 / 12 = <<60/12=5>>5
If she bought one-foot ropes it would cost $62.5 because 5 x 1.25 = 62.5
The cheapest rope to buy is the 6-foot rope because 5 < 62.5
#### 5

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 6.25, not 62.5. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
